Here are some simple Linux commands:
1. ls - list files in the current directory
2. cd <directory> - change directory
3. pwd - show current directory path
4. mkdir <name> - create a new directory
5. touch <file> - create a new empty file
6. rm <file> - remove a file
7. cp <source> <dest> - copy files or directories
8. mv <source> <dest> - move/rename files or directories
9. cat <file> - display file content
10. echo <text> - print text to terminal
11. man <command> - show the manual/help for a command
12. top - display running processes
13. df - show disk usage
14. free - show memory usage
15. uname -a - system info
